author: sinfanti
title: Thankful for a good turkey
review:
My parents bought this for their 4 year old granddaughter.  Although it was too difficult for her to build alone, I was able to build it with her "assistance". 

It is a surprisingly good set.  Unlike many of the holiday mini-sets, which only have a 2-dimensional quality to them, the turkey is really a miniature turkey from any angle.  Once built it held my daughter's attention much longer than the pumpkin.

The playability of the set is fair.  The weakest link is where the feet connect to the body.  This comes off constantly.  If you try to play with it you'll be reattaching the feet constantly.

Overall, this is my favorite of the holiday mini-sets so far and I was surprised at how good it looks once built.
